author: joshf
title: Scale-UP Cardano's Community Hubs
description: How do we encourage Local Community Hubs to drive adoption and awareness of Cardano in 2022?

f6_assessments.q0: As humans, we socialize within our community spaces as part of our socialization process. In order to create meaningful connections among people, building communities is a crucial process that fosters these connections and creates the infrastructure for those connections to occur. This challenge makes a compelling case that the growth of the Cardano community will depend on users from outside of the blockchain community and from local communities.
f6_assessments.q1: The last two funds have demonstrated that the community has the capacity to address this problem. In Fund 6, with only $100,000 available, 32 proposals were submitted, of which only 11 were allocated funds. For Fund 7, with a budget of $35,000,000, 66 proposals were submitted seeking funding, representing an increase of more than 100%.
f6_assessments.q2: Both the criteria and the success metrics suggested are relevant to this challenge's mission, and I believe that the definition of the KPIs will enable effective measurement. To measure progress in addressing the challenge, I strongly believe that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with Fund 8 Strategic Goal of prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem. To improve challenge: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than 1 of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge does an excellent job articulating the case for its budget, demonstrating demand, interest and historical success trend.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are measurable and exceptionally well defined.

f6_assessments.q0:
Without a doubt, the role of the local [grassroots] communities is extremely important in the sustainable development of the Cardano community. Without this [local community hub], Cardano's mission can not achieve.
Therefore, I strongly agree with this proposal's alignment
f6_assessments.q1: This challenge has been voted and approved by the community [F6, F7] with many proposals submitted. The challenge team can be ready at any time. Therefore, without a doubt, I completely agree with the feasibility
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provides clear, logical, and measurable metrics that are precisely set to measure progress in addressing the challenge. As a result, I strongly agree with this proposal's verifiability.

f6_assessments.q0: Providing and funding projects that help grassroot activity is great. This project is trying to provide public knowledge of cardano at a very basic level.
f6_assessments.q1:
This group has laid out exactly the basic needs to start simple hubs and track the growth. I feel the desciption they put forwad shows serious thought and ambition. 
The groups that are listed participating to this proposal are also well established
f6_assessments.q2:
Although the timeline is rather short and ambitious. I feel that the tracking of progress for each micro hub they plan to install is very intuitive. Therefore by throwing a wide net of multiple hubs and closely tracking their traction they will certainly have a large sucess. 
The metrics used to track and audit the progress is put forwrad in great detail

importance: Without users on the ground level, we are building niche products serving mostly technical people with blockchain expertise.
success: Local Community Hubs across the world where the average person can take part in their own language and with their own cultural understanding
